summary: "All in the Family" was a popular American TV sitcom that aired from 1971 to 1979. It was based on a British show and focused on a working-class family, tackling tough issues like racism and women's rights. The series starred Carroll O'Connor and Jean Stapleton. It was very successful, becoming the most-watched show in the U.S. during its first season and winning many awards. The show was known for making people laugh while also making them think about important social topics.
title: All in the Family
